On Thu, 15 Jan 2004, Tiago Fernandez wrote:

> Why to put an assertion in the setUp() method? I think it's nonsense...

The setUp() method is executed before each test method.  If each test
begins with some common checks in the form of assertions, it makes sense
to put that common code in the setUp() method.

Generally speaking, putting assertions in the setUp() method is a bad
idea.  In this particular case, it isn't.

> And why do you like it?

Shorter code is usually better code.
